items.title: Dick Cheney, powerful former vice president, dies at 84
items.standfirst: Former Vice President Dick Cheney, one of the most powerful people to hold the office, has died, his family says. He was 84.
items.content: Former Vice President Dick Cheney, one of the most powerful people to hold the office, has died, his family says. He was 84.

items.title: The political legacy of Dick Cheney, former US vice president
items.standfirst: Dick Cheney, the 46th vice president of the United States under President George W. Bush, died at 84. He was a central figure behind the 'war on terror' and the US invasion of Iraq. With a political career spanning five decades, he reshaped the role of the vice presidency and left a lasting mark on American foreign and security policy. FRANCE 24’s Angela Diffley reviews his career and analyses the legacy of this influential and often controversial statesman.
items.content: Dick Cheney, the 46th vice president of the United States under President George W. Bush, died at 84. He was a central figure behind the 'war on terror' and the US invasion of Iraq. With a political career spanning five decades, he reshaped the role of the vice presidency and left a lasting mark on American foreign and security policy. FRANCE 24’s Angela Diffley reviews his career and analyses the legacy of this influential and often controversial statesman.

items.title: Polls open in US elections - here are five things to watch

items.title: Dick Cheney, key figure in US war on terror, dies at 84
items.standfirst: Dick Cheney, George W. Bush’s powerful vice president and architect of US war policies in Iraq, has died at 84 from pneumonia and heart complications. Long a key Bush ally and former Secretary of Defense, he was both criticized as a Machiavellian figure and praised for transforming US security policy.
items.content: Dick Cheney, George W. Bush’s powerful vice president and architect of US war policies in Iraq, has died at 84 from pneumonia and heart complications. Long a key Bush ally and former Secretary of Defense, he was both criticized as a Machiavellian figure and praised for transforming US security policy.

items.title: Dick Cheney, one of the most powerful vice presidents in American history, dies at 84
items.standfirst: Cheney, who extolled the power of the presidency, died Monday, according to a statement from his family. The cause was complications of pneumonia and cardiac and vascular disease.
items.content: Cheney, who extolled the power of the presidency, died Monday, according to a statement from his family. The cause was complications of pneumonia and cardiac and vascular disease.(Image credit: Charles Dharapak)

items.content: Former US vice president Dick Cheney, one of the leading advocates for the US waging the Iraq War, has died.

ai_summary: Dick Cheney, former Vice President, died at the age of eighty-four, his family announced.
He served as Vice President under George W Bush and was a key figure in the "war on terror".
Cheney's political career spanned five decades, significantly impacting American foreign policy.
News outlets are reporting on his legacy and his impact on the role of the Vice Presidency.
Some sources are discussing his relationship with President Trump and his views on the presidency.

items.title: US: Zohran Mamdani set to become New York’s first Muslim mayor
items.standfirst: It’s the day New Yorkers cast their ballots. Zohran Mamdani, only 34, is emerging as a charismatic figure in the city’s mayoral race. Representing the progressive wing of the Democratic Party, he’s campaigning on bold promises to tackle the high cost of living, expand free childcare, and make public transport more accessible. If elected, Mamdani would become New York City’s first Muslim mayor, signalling a historic moment in the city’s politics, as Jessica Le Masurier explains from New York.
items.content: It’s the day New Yorkers cast their ballots. Zohran Mamdani, only 34, is emerging as a charismatic figure in the city’s mayoral race. Representing the progressive wing of the Democratic Party, he’s campaigning on bold promises to tackle the high cost of living, expand free childcare, and make public transport more accessible. If elected, Mamdani would become New York City’s first Muslim mayor, signalling a historic moment in the city’s politics, as Jessica Le Masurier explains from New York.

Zohran Mamdani, a progressive candidate, is also running for mayor.
If elected, Mamdani would be New York City's first Muslim mayor.

clusters.title: Peru breaks diplomatic relations with Mexico over asylum claim of former prime minister
clusters.neutral_headline: Peru and Mexico Sever Diplomatic Relations

items.title: Peru breaks diplomatic relations with Mexico over asylum claim of former prime minister
Peru cuts ties with Mexico over asylum for ex-prime minister
items.standfirst: Peru has severed diplomatic relations with Mexico after learning that former prime minister Betssy Chávez, accused of helping ex-president Pedro Castillo attempt a coup in 2022, has taken refuge in the Mexican embassy in Lima. Peru’s foreign minister condemned Mexico’s move as interference, while Mexico called its decision to offer asylum “legitimate” under international law. Chávez faces up to 25 years in prison if convicted.
items.content: Peru has severed diplomatic relations with Mexico after learning that former prime minister Betssy Chávez, accused of helping ex-president Pedro Castillo attempt a coup in 2022, has taken refuge in the Mexican embassy in Lima. Peru’s foreign minister condemned Mexico’s move as interference, while Mexico called its decision to offer asylum “legitimate” under international law. Chávez faces up to 25 years in prison if convicted.

items.title: Peru severs diplomatic relations with Mexico after former prime minister claims asylum
items.standfirst: Peru's government has severed diplomatic relations with Mexico over the asylum claim of former Peruvian prime minister Betssy ChávezPeru’s government has announced the country is severing diplomatic relations with Mexico over the asylum claim of the former Peruvian prime minister Betssy Chávez, who is under investigation for rebellion.The Peruvian foreign minister, Hugo de Zela, told reporters Mexico’s decision to grant Chávez asylum at its embassy in Peru’s capital, Lima, constituted an “unfriendly act” that added to the existing tensions between the two countries. The office of Peru’s president, José Jerí, issued a statement accusing Mexico’s government of repeated interference in his country’s internal affairs. Continue reading...
items.content: Peru's government has severed diplomatic relations with Mexico over the asylum claim of former Peruvian prime minister Betssy ChávezPeru’s government has announced the country is severing diplomatic relations with Mexico over the asylum claim of the former Peruvian prime minister Betssy Chávez, who is under investigation for rebellion.The Peruvian foreign minister, Hugo de Zela, told reporters Mexico’s decision to grant Chávez asylum at its embassy in Peru’s capital, Lima, constituted an “unfriendly act” that added to the existing tensions between the two countries. The office of Peru’s president, José Jerí, issued a statement accusing Mexico’s government of repeated interference in his country’s internal affairs. Continue reading...

items.title: Peru cuts diplomatic ties with Mexico over ex-PM's asylum claim
items.standfirst: Lima denounced the decision to grant Betssy Chávez, an alleged co-author of an attempted coup, as an "unfriendly act".
items.content: Lima denounced the decision to grant Betssy Chávez, an alleged co-author of an attempted coup, as an "unfriendly act".

ai_summary: Peru severed diplomatic relations with Mexico over asylum granted to Betssy Chávez.
Chávez is a former Peruvian prime minister facing investigation for rebellion.
Mexico granted Chávez asylum at its embassy in Lima, Peru.
Peru's foreign minister called Mexico's action an "unfriendly act".
Chávez faces up to twenty-five years in prison if convicted.

clusters.title: Tension rises between Trump and NYC over potential Mamdani win
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump and NYC Face Tension Over Potential Mamdani Win

items.title: Tension rises between Trump and NYC over potential Mamdani win
items.standfirst: #NewYork city is electing its new mayor on November 4. But as Zohran #Mamdani is expected to win, US President Donald #Trump threatened to withhold federal funding from the city. A self-proclaimed democratic socialist, Mamdani won the primary earlier this year against ex-governor Andrew Cuomo thanks to an energetic campaign focused on affordable housing.
items.content: #NewYork city is electing its new mayor on November 4. But as Zohran #Mamdani is expected to win, US President Donald #Trump threatened to withhold federal funding from the city. A self-proclaimed democratic socialist, Mamdani won the primary earlier this year against ex-governor Andrew Cuomo thanks to an energetic campaign focused on affordable housing.

items.title: Can Trump legally stop federal funding to New York City if Mamdani wins?
items.standfirst: Trump threw his support behind Cuomo and threatened to cut funding to the city if Mamdani won the mayoral election.

ai_summary: Donald Trump threatened to cut federal funding to New York City.
Trump made the threat if Zohran Mamdani wins the mayoral election.

Mamdani won the primary earlier this year.

items.title: Ukraine: Battle for key city of Pokrovsk rages on
items.standfirst: Russian and Ukrainian forces clashed on Tuesday in Pokrovsk, a key transport and logistics hub in eastern Ukraine that Moscow has sought to capture for over a year. Ukraine reported heavy fighting in areas crucial for frontline logistics, sending reinforcements and additional equipment. Meanwhile, Russia claimed to have cleared 35 buildings of Ukrainian troops and said it was pressuring surrounded forces near Kupiansk in the Kharkiv region.

items.title: How Tanzania’s President Samia Suluhu Hassan went from reform to repression
items.standfirst: Samia Suluhu Hassan was sworn in as Tanzania’s president on Monday after winning an election in which her main rivals had been prevented from running. Once seen as a new democratic hope after first rising to the presidency in 2021, Hassan now stands accused of being at the head of a repressive regime that has violently suppressed historic protests.

items.title: Teenager taken to Ghana away from UK ‘gang culture’ to stay for now, court rules
items.standfirst: Boy had sought court order to force his return, after parents took him on trip to Ghana and returned without himA British teenager whose parents left him in Ghana, fearing he was at risk from “gang culture” in the UK, should stay there until at least the end of his GCSE exams, a judge sitting at London’s high court has ruled.The boy took legal action against his parents, seeking a court order that would force his return, after they enrolled him in a boarding school and arranged for him to live with extended family in Ghana without telling him. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Powerful Afghan earthquake leaves at least 20 dead and hundreds injured

items.title: Powerful Afghan earthquake leaves at least 20 dead and hundreds injured
items.standfirst: Northern provinces of Balkh and Samangan worst hit by magnitude 6.3 quake, which also damaged Mazar-i-Sharif’s Blue MosqueA powerful 6.3 magnitude earthquake shook northern Afghanistan before dawn on Monday, killing at least 20 people and injuring more than 640 others, 25 critically, a disaster management official said. Health officials said the numbers could rise.The US Geological Survey said the quake’s epicentre was located 22km (14 miles) south-west of the town of Khulm, and that it struck at 12.59am at a depth of 28km (17 miles). Continue reading...
